item.title: Interpretability Creationism
item.description: For centuries, Europeans agreed that the presence of a cuckoo egg was a great honor to a nesting bird, as it granted an opportunity to exhibit Christian hospitality. The devout bird enthusiastically fed her holy guest, even more so than she would her own (evicted) chicks (Davies, 2015). In 1859, Charles Darwinâ€™s studies of another occasional brood parasite, finches, called into question any rosy, cooperative view of bird behavior (Darwin, 1859).
